newsitem.title: UK: UK probing claims troops killed Iraqi POWs -paper.
newsitem.headline: UK probing claims troops killed Iraqi POWs -paper.

text.p: Ministry of Defence officials are looking into allegations that British troops shot dead seven Iraqi prisoners captured during the 1991 Gulf War, the Sunday Times newspaper said.
It said detectives from the army's special investigation branch had interviewed dozens of members of the Royal Highland Fusiliers who served in the Gulf about the claims.
Two former medical aides in the Gulf War offered this week to make statements about the alleged incident, it added.
The fusiliers ran the Maryhill prisoner-of-war camp near the town of Hafir al-Batin in Saudi Arabia to which dozens of Iraqi Republican Guards were taken after being captured by British troops.
